intro: Behaimia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban behaimia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation efforts.
